post.description:
Prepare data to enable Deasy auto-suggestions

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to use for classification.
    llm_profile_name: The name of the llm profile to use for classification.
    total_data_sets: The total number of files that will be prepared.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
prepare_data = client.prepare_data.create(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(prepare_data.message)

post.description:
Classify all files in data source in batches with the provided tags

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to use for classification.
    llm_profile_name: The name of the llm profile to use for classification.
    total_data_sets: The total number of files to classify.
    tag_names: The names of the tags to use for classification if tag datas are not provided.
    tag_datas: The data of the tags to use for classification.
    overwrite: Whether to overwrite existing tags.
    hierarchy_name: The name of the graph to use for classification if hierarchy data is not provided.
    hierarchy_data: The data of the graph to use for classification.
    dataslice_id: The id of the dataslice to use for classification file filtering.
    conditions: The conditions to use for classification file filtering.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.classify_bulk.classify(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(response.message)

post.description:
Classify files specified in the request with the provided tags

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to use for classification.
    llm_profile_name: The name of the llm profile to use for classification.
    file_names: The names of the files to classify.
    tag_names: The names of the tags to use for classification if tag datas are not provided.
    tag_datas: The data of the tags to use for classification.
    overwrite: Whether to overwrite existing tags.
    hierarchy_name: The name of the graph to use for classification if hierarchy data is not provided.
    hierarchy_data: The data of the graph to use for classification.
    dataslice_id: The id of the dataslice to use for classification file filtering.
    soft_run: If true, the classification will not save to Deasy and will attempt to return the results.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.classify.classify_files(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(response.message)

post.description:
Suggest a hierarchical tag schema based on file content and existing metadata

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vector database profile to use for accessing file content.
    llm_profile_name: Optional name of the language model profile to use for generating suggestions. Defaults to DeasyLabs compute
    file_names: Optional list of specific files to analyze for the hierarchy suggestion.
    dataslice_id: Optional ID of a dataslice to pull files from for the hierarchy suggestion.
    current_tree: Optional existing hierarchy tree to build upon.
    node: Optional node location of the existing hierarchy tree to build upon.
    condition: Optional filtering condition to select specific files for analysis.
    user_context: Optional user-provided context to guide the suggestion process.
    context_level: Level at which to analyze content ('file' or 'chunk'). Defaults to 'file'.
    max_height: Maximum depth of the generated hierarchy tree. Defaults to 2.
    use_existing_tags: Whether to incorporate existing tags in suggestions. Defaults to False.
    use_extracted_tags: Whether to use previously extracted tags. Defaults to False.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
suggest_schema = client.suggest_schema.create(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(suggest_schema.suggestion)

post.description:
Suggest a description for a tag based on context and vector DB content

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to include in the dataslice.
    llm_profile_name: The name of the llm profile to use for the suggestion.
    tag_name: The name of the tag to suggest a description for.
    context: The context to suggest a description for the tag.
    current_description: The current description of the tag.
    available_values: The available values for the tag.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
suggest_description = client.suggest_description.create(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
    tag_name="tag_name",
)
print(suggest_description.suggestion)

from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.deasy_select.query(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
    query="query",
)
print(response)

post.description:
Create a new tag

Attributes:

    tag_data: The tag data to create the tag with.

Upsert a tag

Attributes:

    tag_data: The tag data to upsert the tag with.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
tags = client.tags.list()
print(tags.tags)

put.description:
Update an existing tag

Attributes:

    tag_data: The tag data to update the tag with.

delete.description:
Delete a tag

Attributes:

    tag_name: The name of the tag to delete.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
tag_response = client.tags.delete(
    tag_name="tag_name",
)
print(tag_response.tag_name)

post.description:
Get tag delete stats

Attributes:

    tag_name: The name of the tag to get the delete stats for.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.tags.get_delete_stats(
    tag_name="tag_name",
)
print(response.dataslices_with_tag)

post.description:
Delete metadata for specified files and tags

Attributes:
    vector_db_config: The vector database configuration to use.
    file_names: The files to delete the metadata for.
    tags: The tags to delete the metadata for.
    conditions: The conditions to delete the metadata for.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
metadata = client.metadata.delete(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(metadata.chunk_deleted_count)

post.description:
Get paginated filtered metadata based on conditions

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to include in the dataslice.
    dataslice_id: The dataslice for getting files from.
    conditions: The conditions to filter the files by.
    tag_names: The names of the tags to include in the metadata.
    include_chunk_level: Whether to include the chunk-level metadata.
    offset: The offset to start the pagination from.
    limit: The limit to the number of metadata to return.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.metadata.list_paginated(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(response.metadata)

post.description:
Get paginated filtered metadata based on conditions

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to include in the dataslice.
    dataslice_id: The dataslice for getting files from.
    conditions: The conditions to filter the files by.
    tag_names: The names of the tags to include in the metadata.
    include_chunk_level: Whether to include the chunk-level metadata.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
metadata = client.metadata.list(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(metadata.metadata)

post.description:
Upsert metadata for files and tags

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to include in the dataslice.
    dataslice_id: The dataslice for getting files from.
    metadata: The metadata to upsert with the form {file_name: {tag_name: tag_value}}.
Get distribution of values for a specific tag, sorted by percentage

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.metadata.get_distributions(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(response.count_distribution)

post.description:
Create a new vdb connector

Attributes:

    connector_name: The profile name of the connector to create.
    connector_body: The body of the connector to create.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
connector_response = client.vdb_connector.create(
    connector_body={
        "collection_name": "collection_name",
        "database_name": "database_name",
        "db_user": "db_user",
        "name": "name",
        "password": "password",
        "port": "port",
        "url": "url",
    },
    connector_name="connector_name",
)
print(connector_response.profile_id)

post.description: List all the vdb connectors

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

print(list_vdb_connector.connectors)

)
print(connector_response.profile_id)

post.description:
Create a new use case based on given conditions

Attributes:

    dataslice_name: The name of the dataslice to create.
    condition: The conditions to qualify files for the dataslice.
    condition_new: The new conditions to qualify files for the dataslice.
    description: The description of the dataslice to create.
    status: The status of the dataslice to create.
    data_points: The data points to include in the dataslice.
    latest_graph: The latest graph to include in the dataslice.
    graph_id: The id of the graph to include in the dataslice.
    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to include in the dataslice.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
dataslice = client.dataslice.create(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
    dataslice_name="dataslice_name",
    graph_id="graph_id",
    latest_graph={
        "foo": "bar"
    },
)
print(dataslice.dataslice_id)

delete.description:
Delete a use case

Attributes:

    dataslice_id: The id of the dataslice to delete.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
dataslice = client.dataslice.delete(
    dataslice_id="dataslice_id",
)
print(dataslice.data)

from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
dataslices = client.dataslice.list()
print(dataslices.dataslices)

post.description: Get count of files matching dataslice conditions or provided conditions

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.dataslice.get_file_count(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(response.file_count)

post.description:
Export file-level/chunk-level metadata for a use case

Attributes:

    data_connector_name: The name of the vdb profile to export metadata from.
    dataslice_id: The id of the dataslice to export metadata from.
    export_file_level: Whether to export file-level metadata or chunk-level metadata.
    export_format: The format to export the metadata in, JSON or CSV.
    selected_metadata_fields: The metadata fields to include in the export.

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.dataslice.export.export_metadata(
    data_connector_name="data_connector_name",
)
print(response)

post.description: Get all files associated with a dataslice

x-codeSamples.source:
from deasy_client import Deasy

client = Deasy()
response = client.dataslice.get_files(
    dataslice_id="dataslice_id",
)
print(response.files)

post.description: Retrieve use case metrics

x-codeSamples.source:

client = Deasy()
response = client.dataslice.get_metrics()
print(response.metadata_tag_counts_distribution)

x-codeSamples.source:

client = Deasy()

post.description:
Upsert a schema in the database.

Attributes:

    schema_name: The stored name of the schema to upsert.
    new_schema_name: The new name of the schema to upsert.
    schema_description: The description of the schema to upsert.
    schema_data: The data of the schema to upsert.

x-codeSamples.source:

client = Deasy()
schema_operation_response = client.schema.upsert(
    schema_name="schema_name",
)
print(schema_operation_response.schema_name)

x-codeSamples.source:

client = Deasy()

print(schemata.schemas)

x-codeSamples.source:

client = Deasy()
schema_operation_response = client.schema.delete(
    schema_name="schema_name",

print(schema_operation_response.schema_name)

tag_names.title: Tag Names
tag_names.description: List of tag names to standardize.

only_dedupe.title: Only Dedupe
only_dedupe.description: If True, only perform simple keyword-based deduplication.

failed_tags.title: Failed Tags
failed_tags.description: Tags that failed standardization, with error messages.

CreatePostgresFromUnstructuredRequest.title: CreatePostgresFromUnstructuredRequest
CreatePostgresFromUnstructuredRequest.description: Request to create a PostgreSQL connector from an unstructured connector

FieldValueDistribution.title: FieldValueDistribution
FieldValueDistribution.description: Distribution of values for a specific field.

tag_name.title: Tag Name
tag_name.description: The name of the tag that was standardized.

before_count.title: Before Count
before_count.description: Number of unique values before standardization.

after_count.title: After Count
after_count.description: Number of unique values after standardization.

StandardizeTagDistributionRequest.title: StandardizeTagDistributionRequest
StandardizeTagDistributionRequest.description: Request for getting tag value distribution

TagDistributions.title: TagDistributions
TagDistributions.description:
Complete tag distribution data structure for analyzing filter impacts.

Maps field names to their value distributions. Used for estimating
search reductions without executing filters.

TagTotalsResponse.title: TagTotalsResponse
TagTotalsResponse.description: Response model for tag total file counts.

Tier.title: Tier
Tier.description: Tier information stored in 'tiers' collection of firestore

ValueDistributionStats.title: ValueDistributionStats
ValueDistributionStats.description: Statistics for a specific tag value.
